title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Telarico F (2023). stopwords: Collection Stopwords StopwordsISO. R package version 0.2.0, https://fatelarico.github.io/stopwords.
code: @Manual{,   title = {stopwords: Collection of Stopwords from StopwordsISO},   author = {Fabio Ashtar Telarico},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://fatelarico.github.io/stopwords}, }

title: Collection of Stopwords from StopwordsISO
text: Author: Fabio Ashtar Telarico, University Ljubljana, FDV

title: Collection of Stopwords from StopwordsISO
text: stopwords R package originally developed Kohei Watanabe Waseda Institute Advanced Study (check publications ) provides easy access stopwords 50 languages Stopwords ISO library. package updated since Dec 22, 2017 installable anymore GitHub. , reboot happened grant continuity project.

title: Collection of Stopwords from StopwordsISO
Collection of Stopwords from StopwordsISO
Collection of Stopwords from StopwordsISO
text: code base changed since version 0.1.0 (last maintained Dr. Watanabe). Now, function stopwords::stopwords() supports two-letter ISO codes, also three-letter ones. Moreover, can identify languages ISO name (e.g., German, Deutsch; Swedish, Sverige, etc.). Also, package depend rjson anymore.

what: Returns all the ISO 639-1 code available in the Stopwords ISO library — languages
title: Returns all the ISO 639-1 code available in the Stopwords ISO library — languages
text: See relevant Wikipedia article details language code.

title: Returns all the ISO 639-1 code available in the Stopwords ISO library — languages
Returns all the ISO 639-1 code available in the Stopwords ISO library — languages
text: data frame row supported languages columns several ISO code (639-2, 639-3, 639-1) name.

what: Returns all the ISO 639-1 code available in the Stopwords ISO library — match.lang
title: Returns all the ISO 639-1 code available in the Stopwords ISO library — match.lang
Returns all the ISO 639-1 code available in the Stopwords ISO library — match.lang
Returns all the ISO 639-1 code available in the Stopwords ISO library — match.lang
text: lang Either ISO 639-2/3 language name derive ISO 639-2 code. language names performs string matching.

title: Returns all the ISO 639-1 code available in the Stopwords ISO library — match.lang
text: character vector containing two-letter ISO 639-1 code associated requested language.

what: Collection of stopwords in multiple languages — stopwords
title: Collection of stopwords in multiple languages — stopwords
text: function returns stop words contained StopwordsISO repository.

title: Collection of stopwords in multiple languages — stopwords
Collection of stopwords in multiple languages — stopwords
text: lang Language retrieve stop word among supported StopwordISO. parameters supports: three-letter ISO 639-2/3 codes (e.g., 'eng'); two-letter ISO639-1 codes ('en'); names based ISO 639-2 codes ('English' 'english') unambiguous substrings ('engl', 'engli', etc.).

title: Collection of stopwords in multiple languages — stopwords
text: character vector containing stop words selected language listed StopwordISO repository.

title: Collection of stopwords in multiple languages — stopwords
code: # They all return the correct list of stop words!  stopwords('German') #>   [1] "a"               "ab"              "aber"            "ach"             #>   [5] "acht"            "achte"
